intro: Baccharoides courtallensis, commonly known as the Sri Lankan baccharis, is a shrub native to the wet zones of Sri Lanka. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in secondary forests and along stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a distinctive, fragrant aroma, while its fruit is a small, dry capsule containing several seeds. Baccharoides courtallensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and birds.
